headline.main: When Generations Are at War Over Sharing Computer Time

lead_paragraph: I AM writing this on a brand new computer. Yes, it is faster than the three-year-old model it replaced; and no, it doesn't grind aloud while it thinks; and true, it is attached to a new printer, which adds color to my writing and prints black and white at twice the rate of its predecessor (may it rest in peace). But none of this is the best part. The addition of this computer means our house now has two -- and that means I finally have my office back. In households everywhere there is a generational turf war over the computer. Whether you work at home or bring work home, I'll wager you've had to arm wrestle for keyboard time if you share disk space with anyone over the age of 5.
abstract: Lisa Belkin Life's Work column on generational turf war in many households over sharing computer time (M)0
